author: Omar Rashid
text:
Amid a raging debate over the chanting of ‘Bharat Mata ki Jai,’ RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Monday said the slogan could not be forced upon people but efforts should be made to build an India where it was chanted voluntarily.

“We have to build such a great Bharatvarsh [India] that Bharat Mata ki Jai is chanted voluntarily across the world, it need not be imposed,” Mr. Bhagwat said here.

“We have to show the way to the people of the world with our life. We do not want to win or defeat anyone. Nor impose our ideology and thoughts on anyone. We wish to show them the path because we accept them as our own,” Mr. Bhagwat told the Sangh cadre in Lucknow, at the unveiling of the renovated ‘Kisan bhawan’ at the historic Smriti Bhawan, the RSS office where the foundation for the erstwhile Bharatiya Jana Sangh was laid in 1951.
title: ‘Bharat Mata ki Jai’ cannot be imposed: Bhagwat
